intro: Pouzolzia huillensis, commonly known as the Huillén pouzolzia, is a flowering plant native to the Andean region of South America. It belongs to the family Polygonaceae, which includes plants commonly known as buckwheats. The plant is characterized by its upright growth habit and lance-shaped leaves with a rough texture. It produces small, clustered flowers that are typically greenish-white in color. Pouzolzia huillensis is often found in rocky or mountainous habitats, thriving in cool and temperate climates.
